title: Unable to create a lobby

embed.description: Provides free image upload and hosting integration for forums. Free picture hosting and photo sharing for websites and blogs.

body: I can't create a lobby for any game. I've restarted the computer and the client. The error is persistant still.

replies.body:
I did the release/renew IP and flushed my DNS and it seemed to work for me.

Press the Windows Key (the key on the left side of the spacebar, between ctrl and alt)
Type cmd
Right-click the Command prompt shortcut and select "Run as Administrator" from the drop down menu. You should now see a black window with white letters.
Type ipconfig /release in the command prompt.
Press [Enter]
Type ipconfig /renew in the command prompt.
Press [Enter]
Type ipconfig /flushdns in the command prompt
Press [Enter]
Close the command prompt and attempt to make a connection.
logged in to upvote

For information: I had this problem two weeks ago, and it occurd a second time yesterday. Two weeks ago the problem was that i installed the tool anti malware bytes, since this moment i couldnt create a lobby. When I removed this tool from my pc, lol worked fine again. Maybe this will help someone, too.

I am having this exact issue still.  I have reinstalled and done everything in the connection guide.  I have not been able to play since the forced client update.
I have the same problem also i rr my client still the same what is going on!!!

I was experiencing the same issue and i think i found a possible fix (at least it worked on my part) i went into the league_client folder (Riot Game> League of Legends > RADS > Projects > league_client > releases) i saw that there is 2 folders 0.0.0.81 and 0.0.0.82 i assume the issue is when u launch the client it runs the league client inside 0.0.0.81 >deploy folder which is an older version.
in this case and when i ran the league client in 0.0.0.82 > deploy folder ( Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\league_client\releases\0.0.0.82\deploy\LeagueClient.exe ) it scans some files (takes few min) then no restored to older installation message appeared and afterward i logged in and play button works. {{champion:86}}

Go into RADS>Projects>league_client>releases and delete the files. I just deleted the oldest one and it was enough to spark a repair when you try to start it again. Took two minutes and worked fine. The error message was the one saying I was running an old client.
Same here
I'm now having the same issue on 2 computers in my house.  I can log in, but my PLAY button is grayed out and says the same thing as in the picture that Okayhavefun posted.
Go to the settings button on top right and click initiate full repair. It worked for me. Plus it doesn't even take long, about 10 to 15 min. But u might have to do it every time u have the problem.

most simple way is uninstall and reinstall (take the most time tho)

Better get rid of the old client, the new one works fine right?

I have the same issue, I have tried everything except re-installing. Extremely annoying.

It looks like your network is having some problems getting a solid connection with our matchmaking system, and so the play button won't let you create a lobby since it knows there isn't a reliable signal to work off of. Try the step in our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) first to see if we can narrow down the main issue. Hit me back if that doesn't help!

I'm having the same issue stated above. I tried everything in the connection guide you linked, tried the hextech repair tool, and even tried reinstalling as admin and nothing has worked.

When I log in the play button is gray, if I hover over it I am told that you're unable to create a lobby. Then, suddenly it'll start trying to download something, the play button becomes a download bar, but it sits at 0%. After a few minutes it makes the "I'm done" noise, but nothing has changed. Then it starts over again. I left it running for the better part of an hour yesterday, no change.
nothing helps atm everything worked fine until this morning
